discussion.content:
there is no information on the console in help.salesforce. I think it is false.
"Salesforce Console for Service Implementation Tips
To use a console for Service, users must be assigned the Service Cloud User feature license.
To use Chat in a console, users must be assigned the Chat User feature license.
If Salesforce Knowledge is set up, turn on the Knowledge sidebar so that console users can automatically see relevant articles alongside any cases that theyâ€™re working on."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=console2_impl_tips.htm&type=5&language=en_US

comments.content: Even SF has quite some contradictory rules between old and new versions. Here, they may be talking about some legacy "Agent Console" which now little information can be searched from Google.

questions.question_text: According to Sales Force, console is not for occasional users of SalesForce. The console is best set up for users who view SalesForce for 3 or more hours a day.
Which objects have built in import wizards?

discussion.content:
Search Results
Featured snippet from the web
The Data Import Wizard makes it easy to import data for many standard Salesforce objects, including accounts, contacts, leads, solutions, campaign members, and person accounts. You can also import data for custom objects. You can import up to 50,000 records at a time.
data loader io is cloud based. so the answer is no

The answer is correct, see: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.data_loader.htm&type=5

What is cloud based is Dataloader.io, but this isn't what's asked.

Selected Answer: A
BUT the user can change to another viewer. Isn't that the purpose of being a Dynamic Dashboard?

questions.question_text: Dynamic Dashboards allow data to be displayed by the user viewing it, rather than by a specified running user - eliminating the need to create the same dashboard for multiple users.

discussion.content: My logic was to choose Tabular Report since there is no grouping required. Happy to be corrected.

questions.question_text:
The Director of Sales wants a report that meets the following criteria:
All accounts in NY, MA, PA and NJ Account rating of "Hot" or Annual Rev over $8M .The report must meet the state criteria but can optionally meet the account rating or the annual revenue.
Which report format would you use to create this custom report?
